roleset.name: provide an argument, say, make an argument for or against something
roleset.note: ARGUE-V NOTES: VN updated by Julia. No VNcls-- Vncls's fit better with other sense. See FN for structure. Comparison with say. (from argue.01-v)
ARGUMENT-N NOTES: Based on verb entry argue.01; corresponding Vncls's fit better with other sense. (from argument.01-n)

example.name: typical usage
example.text: Program traders argue that a reinstatement of the rule would destroy the ``pricing efficiency'' of the futures and stock markets.
example.arg: that a reinstatement of the rule would destroy the ``pricing efficiency'' of the futures and stock markets

example.name: with listener
example.text: John passionately argued his case to Mary.

example.name: All Arguments
example.text: Darnton extends his argument to the scandalous libelles against Marie Antoinette.

example.name: Args 0 & 1
example.text: Her husband was not convinced by her argument that they needed a bigger house.
example.arg: that they needed a bigger house.

roleset.name: argue with, have an argument with someone else
roleset.note: ARGUE-V NOTES: Member of Vncls correspond-36.1-1-1, battle-36.4-1, chit_chat-37.6. Comparison with compete, negotiate (from argue.02-v)
ARGUMENT-N NOTES: Based on verb entry argue.02; corresponds to Vncls correspond-36.1-1-1, battle-36.4-1, chit_chat-37.6. (from argument.02-n)

example.name: I can't believe this hasn't occurred yet
example.text: John argued with Mary about the cause of his noxious foot odor.

example.name: merged arguers
example.text: John and Mary argued about the cause of his noxious foot odor.
example.arg: about the cause of his noxious foot odor

example.name: All arguments
example.text: She could have stayed at the clinic and finished her argument with Franck about the relative merits of realism in television.
